data.meta_description: Other articles where The Clock is discussed: Vincente Minnelli: Films of the later 1940s: Meet Me in St. Louis, The Clock, and The Pirate: …then asked to take over The Clock (1945), his first nonmusical picture. This wartime homefront romance originally was to have been directed by Jack Conway and then, when Conway took ill, Fred Zinnemann. But Garland insisted that Minnelli—who was not dating her at that moment—replace Zinnemann. A corporal (Robert Walker)…
data.text:
In Vincente Minnelli: Films of the later 1940s: Meet Me in St. Louis, The Clock, and The Pirate

…then asked to take over The Clock (1945), his first nonmusical picture. This wartime homefront romance originally was to have been directed by Jack Conway and then, when Conway took ill, Fred Zinnemann. But Garland insisted that Minnelli—who was not dating her at that moment—replace Zinnemann. A corporal (Robert Walker)…
